fields.headline: 'We must score first', says bullish McGhee
fields.bodyText: The Scottish side need to overturn a 1-0 deficit but their manager, Mark McGhee, claims his men can even afford to concede an away goal - providing it is not the opener. "For me, it's only important that we score first," he said. "I think if they score first, it will maybe kill the atmosphere." McGhee played five across midfield in France but will be more positive tonight. "We feel that three up front is a good way of playing so it's definitely an option," he said. TV: BBC1 Scotland, kick-off 7.45pm
